intro: Campylostachys abbreviata, commonly known as the narrowleaf campylostachys, is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a small, shrub-like plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves with a distinctive narrow shape. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in small clusters, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Campylostachys abbreviata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh conditions.
